com.hazelcast.map.impl.journal

Class RingbufferMapEventJournalImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hazelcast.map.impl.journal.RingbufferMapEventJournalImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    EventJournal<InternalEventJournalMapEvent>, MapEventJournal

    public class RingbufferMapEventJournalImpl
extends Object
implements MapEventJournal
    The map event journal implementation based on the Ringbuffer. It will add all journal events into a RingbufferContainer with the provided namespace and partition ID and allows checking if the map has a configured event journal. Adapts the EventJournalConfig to the RingbufferConfig when creating the ringbuffer.

      • writeUpdateEvent

        public void writeUpdateEvent(EventJournalConfig journalConfig,
                             ObjectNamespace namespace,
                             int partitionId,
                             Data key,
                             Object oldValue,
                             Object newValue)
        Description copied from interface: MapEventJournal
        Writes an EntryEventType.UPDATED to the event journal. If there is no event journal configured for this map, the method will do nothing. If an event is added to the event journal, all parked operations waiting for new events on that journal will be unparked.
        Specified by:
        writeUpdateEvent in interface MapEventJournal
        Parameters:
        journalConfig - the event journal config for the map in which the event occurred
        namespace - the map namespace
        partitionId - the entry key partition
        key - the entry key
        oldValue - the old value
        newValue - the new value

      • isPersistenceEnabled

        public boolean isPersistenceEnabled(ObjectNamespace namespace,
                                    int partitionId)
        Description copied from interface: EventJournal
        Returns true if the event journal has persistence enabled and can be queried for events older than the EventJournal.oldestSequence(ObjectNamespace, int). If the journal is not backed by a persistent store, this method will return false.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
        namespace - the object namespace
        partitionId - the partition ID of the event journal
        Returns:
        if the journal is backed by a persistent store and can serve events older than the oldest sequence

      • isAvailableOrNextSequence

        public void isAvailableOrNextSequence(ObjectNamespace namespace,
                                      int partitionId,
                                      long sequence)
        Description copied from interface: EventJournal
        Checks if the sequence is of an item that can be read immediately or is the sequence of the next item to be added into the event journal. Since this method allows the sequence to be one larger than the EventJournal.newestSequence(ObjectNamespace, int), the caller can use this method to check the sequence before performing a possibly blocking read.
        Specified by:
        isAvailableOrNextSequence in interface EventJournal<InternalEventJournalMapEvent>
        Parameters:
        namespace - the object namespace
        partitionId - the partition ID of the entries in the journal
        sequence - the sequence wanting to be read

      • isNextAvailableSequence

        public boolean isNextAvailableSequence(ObjectNamespace namespace,
                                       int partitionId,
                                       long sequence)
        Description copied from interface: EventJournal
        Checks if the sequence is the sequence of the next event to be added to the event journal.
        Specified by:
        isNextAvailableSequence in interface EventJournal<InternalEventJournalMapEvent>
        Parameters:
        namespace - the object namespace
        partitionId - the partition ID of the entries in the journal
        sequence - the sequence to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the sequence is one greater than the sequence of the last event, false otherwise

      • readMany

        public <T> long readMany(ObjectNamespace namespace,
                         int partitionId,
                         long beginSequence,
                         ReadResultSetImpl<InternalEventJournalMapEvent,T> resultSet)
        Description copied from interface: EventJournal
        Reads events from the journal in batches. It will read up to the maximum number that the set can hold - see ReadResultSetImpl.isMaxSizeReached() or until the journal is exhausted. The resultSet allows filtering and projections on journal items so that the caller can control which data is returned.

        If the set has reached its max size, the returned sequence is one greater than the sequence of the last item in the set. In other cases it means that the set hasn't reached its full size because we have reached the end of the event journal. In this case the returned sequence is one greater than the sequence of the last stored event.

        Specified by:
        readMany in interface EventJournal<InternalEventJournalMapEvent>
        Type Parameters:
        T - the return type of the projected events
        Parameters:
        namespace - the object namespace
        partitionId - the partition ID of the entries in the journal
        beginSequence - the sequence of the first item to read.
        resultSet - the container for read, filtered and projected events
        Returns:
        returns the sequenceId of the next item to read
        See Also:
        EventJournal.isAvailableOrNextSequence(ObjectNamespace, int, long)

      • cleanup

        public void cleanup(ObjectNamespace namespace,
                    int partitionId)
        Description copied from interface: EventJournal
        Cleans up the event journal by removing any expired items. Items are considered expired according to the configured expiration policy.
        Specified by:
